Package rockpaperscissors

Class ConsolePrompts

  • java.lang.Object
    • rockpaperscissors.ConsolePrompts

  • public class ConsolePrompts
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all the prompts that allow the user to control the program to their choosing.
    Author:
    Karanvir

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ConsolePrompts​()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int compPrompt​()
      Prompts the user if they would like to see two computers with strategies fight, one computer with a strategy and one that chooses random weapons fight, or two computers that both choose random weapons fight.
      int playerPrompt​()
      Prompts the user to choose whether they would like to play against a computer with a strategy, or a computer that randomly makes its choices.
      int PlyrOrComp​()
      Prompts the user to choose whether they would like to play against a computer themselves, or have the computer go up against another computer and watch the match between the two AI.
      int rndPrompt​()
      Prompts the user to input how many rounds they would like to play.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ConsolePrompts

        public ConsolePrompts​()

    • Method Detail

      • rndPrompt

        public int rndPrompt​()
        Prompts the user to input how many rounds they would like to play.
        Returns:
        rounds The amount of rounds inputed by the user.

      • PlyrOrComp

        public int PlyrOrComp​()
        Prompts the user to choose whether they would like to play against a computer themselves, or have the computer go up against another computer and watch the match between the two AI.
        Returns:
        choice The choice that the user made for this prompt.

      • playerPrompt

        public int playerPrompt​()
        Prompts the user to choose whether they would like to play against a computer with a strategy, or a computer that randomly makes its choices.
        Returns:
        choice The choice that the user made for this prompt.

      • compPrompt

        public int compPrompt​()
        Prompts the user if they would like to see two computers with strategies fight, one computer with a strategy and one that chooses random weapons fight, or two computers that both choose random weapons fight.
        Returns:
        choice The choice that the user made for this prompt.
